messages.content: You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the provided links in the document for?

The provided links are for the code and document related to deep learning models and tutorials. Specifically, they are: https://github.com/aws-samples/deep-learning-models/blob/master/utils/tensorflow/preprocess_imagenet.py and https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ko_kr/dlami/latest/devguide/tutorial-horovod-tensorflow.html.
What is the command to preprocess ImageNet data using the provided script?

The command to preprocess ImageNet data is: 
```
python preprocess_imagenet.py \ --local_scratch_dir=[YOUR DIRECTORY] \ --imagenet_username=[imagenet account] \ --imagenet_access_key=[imagenet access key]
```
What should be done after data transformation according to the document?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket. Additionally, you should create a snapshot of the EBS volume.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How can you use TensorFlow's download script to download the ImageNet dataset?

You can use TensorFlow's download script by exporting your username and access key. The steps include exporting your username and access key, navigating to the imagenet/data directory, renaming the validation synset labels file, and running the download script with nohup.
What is the alternative method if TensorFlow's download script does not work?

The alternative method involves manually downloading the ImageNet dataset using wget commands for different parts of the dataset, such as the training images, training bounding boxes, validation images, and validation bounding boxes.
How do you extract the validation set after downloading it manually?

To extract the validation set, you need to create a directory named 'validation', move the ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar file into this directory, navigate into the 'validation' directory, and then extract the tar file using the 'tar xf' command.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How many GPUs and instances were used in vd_train_log?
vd_train_log used 32 GPUs and 4 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the Horovod size and TensorFlow version used in eval_hvd_train.log?
The Horovod size was 8 and the TensorFlow version used was TF1.13.1.
What was the top1 and top5 accuracy at step 14075 during the evaluation in eval_hvd_train.log?
At step 14075, the top1 accuracy was 75.821 and the top5 accuracy was 92.90.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should you do if you do not know how to mount an EBS volume on /data?
You may refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ebs-using-volumes.html if you do not know how to mount it.
What repositories need to be downloaded for the setup?

You need to download the MXNet repository and the TensorFlow models repository. You can do this by running the commands: 
\$ cd /data 
\$ git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models.git 
\$ git clone https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet.git 
Alternatively, you can install MXNet by typing `pip install mxnet`.
What is the purpose of using symbolic links in this setup?

The symbolic links are used for convenience. For example, the symbolic link `imagenet` points to `/data/models/research/inception/inception` and the symbolic link `mxnet` points to `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mxnet`.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should you do after training according to the document?
After training, you should check the training log and evaluation log by checking the imagenet_resnet folder.
What does the image description mention about downloading the ImageNet dataset?

The image description mentions that the image displays a portion of a web page with instructions on downloading the ImageNet dataset using a script. It includes a link to the script on GitHub and emphasizes the necessity of exporting your username and access key.
What does the code snippet in the image description include?

The code snippet in the image description includes setting environment variables using `export`, navigating to the `imagenet/data` directory with `cd`, renaming a file with `mv`, and running a script (`download_imagenet.sh`) with `nohup bash`, logging the output to `download.log`.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the size and timestamp of the file model.ckpt-10000.meta?
The file model.ckpt-10000.meta has a size of 5709416 bytes and a timestamp of Sep 23 01:53.
How many parts does the file model.ckpt-20000.data have and what are their sizes?
The file model.ckpt-20000.data has two parts: model.ckpt-20000.data-00000-of-00002 with a size of 8 bytes, and model.ckpt-20000.data-00001-of-00002 with a size of 204668736 bytes.
What is the timestamp and size of the file model.ckpt-20000.meta?
The file model.ckpt-20000.meta has a timestamp of Sep 23 02:54 and a size of 5709416 bytes.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should be done after data transformation when backing up and copying to S3?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket, and create a snapshot of the EBS volume.
What is the purpose of the provided links in the text?

The provided links are for additional resources if you want to train on a single machine using RecordIO and TFRecord, and for a hands-on guide to fast training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod.
What is the main focus of Step 2 in the text?
Step 2 focuses on training the ResNet-50 model with Horovod.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What type of EC2 instance is recommended for distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy?

For distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy, it is recommended to create an EC2 instance with Deep Learning AMI (Ubuntu 16.04) or Deep Learning AMI (Amazon Linux). Specifically, p3.16xlarge or p3dn.24xlarge instances are recommended.
What is the default root volume size for the recommended EC2 instances, and what is the suggested size increase?

The default root volume size for the recommended EC2 instances is 75GB. It is suggested to increase the root volume size to 100GB since training logs and model checkpoints are stored in the root volume if the training configuration is not modified.
What should you do if you do not want to increase the root volume size of the EC2 instance?
If you do not want to increase the root volume size of the EC2 instance, you can delete some conda environments such as Theano, Chainer, Caffe, and Caffe2 after logging in to the EC2 instance.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
Why is it important to install OpenCV when working with ImageNet raw data?
It is important to install OpenCV because without it, you cannot convert ImageNet raw data to RecordIO files since im2rec.py utilizes some OpenCV functions.
Why is Python2 recommended over Python3 for Tensorflow models repository?
Python2 is recommended over Python3 because many codes of Tensorflow models repository do not work on Python3.
What steps are involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet?

The steps involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet include creating a directory named 'train', moving the ILSVRC2012_img_train.tar file to the 'train' directory, extracting the tar file, and then creating subdirectories for each tar file within the 'train' directory. After extraction, you should check if the number of directories is 1,000, with class 1 being n01728572 and class 1000 being n15075141.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How many GPUs and instances were used in the hvd_train_log?
The hvd_train_log used 64 GPUs and 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the speed and loss at step 7000 in the hvd_train_log?
At step 7000 in the hvd_train_log, the speed was 41958.4 and the loss was 0.624.
How long did the training in hvd_train_log take to finish?
The training in hvd_train_log finished in 2685.1825189590454 seconds.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the file size and name of the file created on October 1 at 00:01?
The file created on October 1 at 00:01 is named ILSVRC2012_bbox_train_v2.tar.gz and its size is 19537608 bytes.
Which file has the largest size and what is its name?
The file with the largest size is ILSVRC2012_img_train.tar, and its size is 147897477120 bytes.
What is the format used for data transformation and what tool is recommended for RecordIO format?
The formats used for data transformation are RecordIO and TFRecord. For RecordIO format, it is recommended to use im2rec.py the same way Simon did.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What do you need to do if you want to train on distributed GPUs?
If you want to train on distributed GPUs, you need to create multiple GPU instances with the same setting.
What is an example of multiple GPU instances for distributed training?
An example of multiple GPU instances for distributed training is 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What is the URL for the remaining steps in the tutorial?
The URL for the remaining steps in the tutorial is https://docs.aws.amazon.com/dlami/latest/devguide/tutorial-horovod-tensorflow.html.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned in the text?

The different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned are: s3://dataset-image/imagenet/raw (raw jpeg), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord (TFRecord before resizing), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord-resized (TFRecord after resizing to 224x224), and s3://dataset-image/imagenet/recordio (RecordIO after resizing to 256x256).
Why was the ImageNet dataset not resized to 224x224 in RecordIO format?

The ImageNet dataset was not resized to 224x224 in RecordIO format because the article at https://forums.fast.ai/t/impact-of-image-resizing-on-model-training-time-and-performance/1980 shows different validation accuracy for resizing strategy.
What are the steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset?

The steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset include creating an EC2 instance (Ubuntu 18.04 or 16.04, t2.micro is available but t2.large is recommended due to memory size), creating an EBS volume (1.0TB) for the ImageNet dataset, and attaching the volume to the EC2 instance.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
Who is the author of the document on Fast Training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod?
The author of the document is Daekeun Kim (daekeun@amazon.com).
What is the goal of the document?
The goal of the document is to provide guidance for people who need distributed GPU training using Horovod for experimental purposes.
What type of instances are recommended for data preparation and transformation, and what type for distributed training?

For data preparation and data transformation, cheaper instances like t2.large with 1.0TB EBS volume are recommended. For distributed training, multiple GPU instances like p2, p3, g3, and g4 are needed.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How much space does the ImageNet training and validation set require?
ImageNet consists of 138GB for the training set and 6.3GB for the validation set, but additional space is needed to extract tar files and transform them into feature sets like TFRecord and RecordIO.
What is the purpose of the example command using AWS CLI provided in the text?

The example command using AWS CLI is to create and attach a volume to your EC2 instance. It specifies the size, region, availability zone, volume type, and tags for the volume, and then attaches the volume to the specified EC2 instance.
What are the steps to attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI?

The steps to attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI are: 
1. Create the volume with the specified size, region, availability zone, volume type, and tags using the `aws ec2 create-volume` command.
2. Attach the created volume to the EC2 instance using the `aws ec2 attach-volume` command, specifying the volume ID, instance ID, and device.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the first step to prepare the validation set for ImageNet?

The first step is to create a directory named 'validation' using the command `$ mkdir validation`, then move the file `ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar` into the 'validation' directory using `$ mv ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar validation`, and finally change into the 'validation' directory using `$ cd validation`.
How do you extract the contents of the validation set tar file?
You extract the contents of the validation set tar file by running the command `$ tar xf ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar` inside the 'validation' directory.
What should be done after extracting the validation set?

After extracting the validation set, you should move the jpeg files (e.g., ILSVRC2012_val_00000001.JPEG, ILSVRC2012_val_00050000.JPEG) into 1,000 directories, each representing a unique category, using the provided script from the URL: https://github.com/juliensimon/aws/blob/master/mxnet/imagenet/build_validation_tree.sh.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What can you skip if you do not want to invent the wheel again?
You can skip step 1 if you do not want to invent the wheel again because everything is stored in the s3 bucket.
What is the title of the hands-on guide mentioned in the text?
The title of the hands-on guide is "Fast Training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod."
Where can the hands-on guide be accessed?
The hands-on guide can be accessed at the following URL: https://daekeun.notion.site/Hands-on-Fast-Training-ImageNet-on-on-demand-EC2-GPU-instances-with-Horovod-eb49f580d1304082b497d91dec887dca.
